title: An assertive way of being
description: Welcome to the real world. The world where you have to deal with real people. It's hard, isn't it? It's not always pleasant and stress-free. In this course you will have a chance to test and adjust your behaviors in 5 different situations. What will you do? Which behavior will you adopt? You will also learn which techniques to use to make your interactions more effective and assertive.

cover_slide_data.heading: AN Assertive way of being
cover_slide_data.intro: How to win people over and stay sane

cover_slide_data.heading: AN Assertive way of being
cover_slide_data.intro: How to win people over and stay sane

published_attributes.title: Welcome!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
There is a thin line between love and hate. So is it between assertiveness and other, inefficient communication strategies. Do you know what it is?

Can you behave assertively? Can you defend your stand, not hurt others and create win-win situations?

We invite you to take a shot at this short course. It should take a maximum of 60 minutes, if you decide to go over all paths in the following sections.

  1. Over the next few steps you will have a chance to make decisions in difficult situations: observe the outcomes and draw conclusions.
  2. Then you can engage yourself in a series of summary quizzes and test your skills.

Are you in? Let's go!

published_attributes.title: What is assertiveness about?
published_attributes.serialized_body: Here's a brief intro to assertiveness basics. Watch the short video and think about the least and the most assertive moment in your life. Share it in the comments.

published_attributes.title: Assertiveness - make the right choice
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In the following section you will have to make tough choices and accept their consequences.

You will be faced with 5 problematic situations. Make various choices and discover what consequences lurk behind the corner.

The first 5 exercises are branching scenarios - they show how events can unravel depending on various micro- or macro-messages. We invite you to explore all of the paths in the scenarios. Even if some might seem a bit obvious, they do reflect a lot of actual communication - full of inaccurate or biased language use or misinterpretation.

It's not about finding or choosing "the right" path, but about exploring how micro-messages might influence the overall flow of communication. Feel free to try out all the rest.

We recommend you try them all, but you might also skip them and move on.

If you feel like the exact situation might not concern you - try to see how it could translate onto your field.

You will experience 3 levels of situational complexity, with the stakes getting higher.

Now you are entering level 1. Enjoy.

published_attributes.title: 1. Assertiveness - asking for help
published_attributes.serialized_body:
This scenario includes 8 paths you can take. Each choice you make leads to a consequence. Once you reach the end of one path, reflect on it. Then feel free to try out all the rest.

Start with pressing the "See and Decide" button to enter the interactive simulation.

Follow the steps within, trying various paths. In the comment section below share your ideas on how this situation could unravel further.

Once you do all above, press the "Continue" button below the interactive section.

published_attributes.title: Level 2
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You have experienced level 1 of situational complexity - simple, day-to-day conversations with colleagues.

Now you are entering level 2. These situations are more complex, concern more delicate topics and might bear greater consequences.

Are you ready?

published_attributes.title: What describes various behavior types?
published_attributes.serialized_body:
There are 4 major behavior types: assertive, aggressive, passive and passive-aggressive. Discover various characteristics that describe particular behaviors and try guessing what it is in the game below.

The previous exercise with branching scenarios has shown you that there is a thin line between being assertive and aggressive. Now you will organize your knowledge and reflect.

published_attributes.title: Decipher behaviors
published_attributes.serialized_body:
If you are reading this, it means you are ready to put your knowledge to the test. You will be faced with different examples of behaviors or situations. Use everything you have learned to pin-point the right answer.

This quiz is NOT graded.

published_attributes.title: Assertive Techniques
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You have seen some examples of assertive behaviors already. Examine the techniques below all brought together and see which one works best for you.

Click on each "+" sign learn more about the technique and see examples.

Can you think of specific situations you might use particular techniques? Share your observations in the comments.

published_attributes.title: Assertiveness 101
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You have reached almost the end. This is where you can summarize everything you have learned: behaviors, strategies and actions. Revise it before taking a short test. Move ot the next slide with the downwards facing arrow on the right-hand side.

Also feel free to share any insights from the course or your experience in the comment section below. Treat it a platform to exchange view with others.

published_attributes.title: Additional resources
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Watch this TED video on the importance of giving assertive feedback. Cognitive psychologist LeeAnn Renniger shares a scientifically proven method for giving effective feedback in a highly assertive way.

What is the role of assertiveness in giving feedback from your experience? Feel free to shar that in the comment section below.

published_attributes.title: Test
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Congratulations. You have completed the short survival course on handling difficult people... I mean situations.

Take some time to answer a few questions that will show you if there is anything else you need to work on.

Good luck!

published_attributes.title: Assertiveness is about finding balance, not winning.

draft_attributes.title: Assertiveness is about finding balance, not winning.

published_attributes.title: Fogging consists in admitting your wrongdoing and facing it.

draft_attributes.title: Fogging consists in admitting your wrongdoing and facing it.

answers.body: Preparing for criticism or some bad news, making them lose arguments, e.g. "you'll be mad, but I... ."
Giving yourself time to think about the situation and responding peacefully, stalling a little.
Repeating the same firm statement, do not change your mind or add anything new.
Preparing for criticism or some bad news, making them lose arguments, e.g. "you'll be mad, but I... ."
Giving yourself time to think about the situation and responding peacefully, stalling a little.
Repeating the same firm statement, do not change your mind or add anything new.
Using strong and decisive verbs (must, have to, should)
Referring to behaviors and situations, not people

published_attributes.title: The elements of assertive language are:

answers.body: Using strong and decisive verbs (must, have to, should)
Referring to behaviors and situations, not people

published_attributes.title: Thank you!
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Thanks for taking the time to complete this course. We hope you now have a better understanding of what assertiveness is. Please keep in mind that developing the right behavior takes a lot of time and effort. Practicing is the key to success.

We'd love to learn about your experience with the course. Please take a moment to complete this feedback form here.

To complete the course and see your test results please hit the "Complete" button below 👇👇👇.
